protocol.description:
This protocol allows for a Wayland clients to subscribe to input trigger actions for "begin", "update, and "end" notifications.
ext_input_trigger_action_v1 and the associated ext_input_trigger_registration_v1 are based on the following discussion document: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Hj3BXkmW1quIEWqmN7xeJY29nSPfXP2bmoZvpOsEeJQ/

interface.name: ext_input_trigger_action_manager_v1

description.summary: used to register interest in input actions

interface.description: This interface allows a Wayland client to register interest in input trigger actions.

request.name: destroy

description.summary: destroy input trigger activation manager object

request.description: This informs the compositor that the input trigger activation manager object will no longer be used. Existing objects created through this interface remain valid.

request.name: get_input_trigger_action

description.summary: register interest in input trigger action

request.description:
This request creates an input trigger action object.
The token should be one issued by the compositor, if not then the compositor can raise a protocol error.
If the token has been issued by the compositor, but is no longer available, then an ext_input_trigger_action_v1.unavailable event should be sent immediately.

interface.name: ext_input_trigger_action_v1

description.summary: receives notifications of input trigger actions

interface.description: The compositor sends notification of the triggering of the associated action.

event.name: begin
event.description:
One of the input triggers associated with the action has occurred.
The app may begin the activity it associates with the action.

event.name: update
event.description:
The input trigger that led to the "begin" event has changed.
This will be sent between the "begin" and "end" events when there is a meaningful update to the input trigger. (E.g. a multi-touch drag)
The app may update the activity it associates with the action.

event.name: end
event.description:
The input trigger that led to the "begin" event has stopped.
The app may end (or begin!) the activity it associates with the action.

event.name: unavailable

description.summary: the input action is (or has become) unavailable

event.description:
Sent if the token is or becomes unavailable.
This means the object is of no further use and should be destroyed.

request.name: destroy
request.description: This informs the compositor that the input trigger activation will no longer be used.
